p: Reports by Imevbore and Adeyemi [ 16] show that gas flaring reduced the nutritional quality of crops. Low yam and cassava yields have also been reported within a 2 km radius of a flare site [ 17]. Consumption of leafy green vegetables, particularly Telfairia occidentalis, is very common in Nigeria. Telfairia occidentalis is a rich source of minerals, vitamins, protein and phytochemicals [ 18]. The nutritional value of plants can be negatively affected by the presence of toxic compounds in the soil and atmosphere [ 19].
